page.title: 10Lack of Amenities,Montrose.
page.content: In 1984, the local Primary School carried out a{survey}of the attitudes of parents to the lack of services and amenities in the{Borrowfield area.}At the time of the survey there was only one small shop (Spar),one pub (Black Abbot), a community centre built and funded by local residents, and the school. Given the choice of shops in the area, a chemist was by far the most preferred. Next came a post office followed by a supermarket, butcher and bakery. Again, a doctor's surgery was clear favourite in a choice of "services" with a bank second. A police office came third in the voting. The lack of amenities in the area is a concern to all groups in the community and there seems to be {little hope of any improvement.}We will have to continue to go "up the street" for nearly all of our needs!
